name: All register/records are identified and numbered

blood is kept on optimum temperature before transfusion

Death note is written on patient record
Death note including efforts done for resuscitation is noted in patient record
meansOfVerification: Maternal and neonatal death are recorded as per MDR guideline

name: There is established criteria for distinguish between newborn death and still birth
meansOfVerification: Every still record/ birth is examined by paediatrician before declaration

name: Death summary is given to patient attendant quoting the immediate cause and underlying cause if possible
Facility provides and updates Mother and Child Protection Card.
Tests for Urine albumin, haemoglobin, blood grouping
Management of 1st stage of labour:
meansOfVerification: Check progress is recorded, Women is allowed to give birth in the position she wants , Check progress is recorded on partograph

name: Management of 2nd stage of labour:
meansOfVerification: Allows the spontaneous delivery of head , gives Perineal support and assist in delivering baby. Check progress is recorded on partograph

name: Active Management of Third stage of labour
meansOfVerification: Palpation of  mother's abdomen to rule out presence of second baby

name: Use of Uterotonic Drugs
meansOfVerification: Administration of 10 IU of oxytocin IM with in 1 minute of Birth

name: Control Cord Traction
meansOfVerification: Only during Contraction

name: Uterine Massage
meansOfVerification: After placenta expulsion , Checks Placenta & Membranes for Completeness

name: Staff is aware of Indications for refereeing patient for to Surgical Intervention
meansOfVerification: Ask staff how they identify slow progress of labour , Hoe they interpret Partogram

name: Management and follow up of PIH/Eclampsia \Pre Eclampsia
meansOfVerification:
Monitors BP in every case, and tests for proteinuria if BP is >140/90 mmHg 
If BP is 140/90 mmHg or more with proteinuria 2+  along with any two of the following danger signs: severe headache, blurring of vision, severe pain abdomen or reduced urine output, BP > 160/110 or more with proteinuria 3+;  OR in cases of eclampsiaadministers loading dose of Magnesium Sulphate (MgSO4) and refers/ calls for specialist attention; continues maintenance dose of MgSO4- 5 g of MgSO4 IM in alternate buttocks every four hours, for 24 hours after birth/last convulsion, whichever is later
If BP is >160/110 mmHg or more, give appropriate anti-hypertensive (Hydralazine/Methyl Dopa/ Nifedipine)

name: Management of Postpartum Haemorrhage
meansOfVerification: Assessment of bleeding (PPH if >500 ml or > 1 pad soaked in 5 Minutes. IV Fluid, bladder catheterization, measurement of urine output,  Administration of 20 IU of Oxytocin in 500 ml Normal Saline or RL at 40-60 drops per minute . Performs Bimanual Compression of Uterus

name: Management of Retained Placenta
meansOfVerification: Administration of another dose of Oxytocin 20IU in 500 ml of RL at 40-60 drops/min an attempt to deliver placenta with repeat controlled cord traction. If this fails performs manual removal of Placenta

name: Management of Uterine Atony
meansOfVerification: Vigorous Uterine massage, gives Oxytocin 20 IU in 500 ml of R/L  40 to 60 drops/minute (Continue to administer Oxytocin upto maximum of 3 litres of solution with Oxytocin) If still bleeding perform bi manual uterine compression with palpation of femoral pulse

name: Management of Obstructed Labour
meansOfVerification: Diagnoses obstructed labour based on data registered from the partograph, Re-hydrates the patient to maintain normal plasma volume, check vitals, gives broad spectrum antibiotics, perform bladder catheterization and takes blood for Hb & grouping, Decides on the mode of delivery as per the condition of mother and the baby

name: Management of Puerperal sepsis
meansOfVerification: Diagnosis puerperal sepsis based on clinical criteria: continuous fever for at least 24 hours or recurring within the first 10 days after delivery, increased pulse rate, increased respiration, offensive/foul smelling lochia, sub involution of the uterus, headache and general malaise, pelvic pain, pain, swelling and pus discharge from laceration or episiotomy or incision. Conduct appropriate lab. investigations, Prescribes IV fluids and broad spectrum antibiotics for seven days & advises perineal care

name: Delivery of  infectious cases HIV positive PW
Recording date and Time of Birth, Weight
meansOfVerification: Check the records

name: Dried and put on mothers abdomen
meansOfVerification: With a clean towel from head to feet, discards the used towel and covers baby including head in a clean dry towel

name: Vitamin K for low birth weight
meansOfVerification: Given to all new born (1.0 mg IM in > 1500 gms and 0.5 mg in < 1500 gms

name: Warmth
meansOfVerification: Check use of radiant warmer

name: Care of Cord and Eyes
meansOfVerification:
Delayed Cord Clamping, Clamps & Cut the cords by sterile instruments within 1-3 minutes of Birth  
Clean baby's eyes with sterile cotton/Gauge

name: APGAR Score
meansOfVerification: Check practice of maintaining APGAR Score, Nurse is skilled for it

meansOfVerification: Observe /Ask staff about the practice

Initiation of Breastfeeding with in 1 Hour

meansOfVerification:
Ask staff about how they decontaminate the procedure surface like Examination table , dressing table, Stretcher/Trolleys  etc. 
(Wiping with .5% Chlorine solution
name: Decontamination of operating & Procedure surfaces

meansOfVerification:
Ask staff how they decontaminate the instruments like Stethoscope, Dressing Instruments, Examination Instruments, Blood Pressure Cuff etc
(Soaking in 0.5% Chlorine Solution, Wiping with 0.5% Chlorine Solution
name: Proper Decontamination of instruments after use

meansOfVerification: 10 minutes
name: Contact time for decontamination  is adequate

meansOfVerification: Cleaning is done with detergent and running water after decontamination
name: Cleaning of instruments after decontamination

meansOfVerification: No sorting ,Rinsing or sluicing at Point of use/ Patient care area
